data.title: Lisa Faulkner interview: on motherhood and marrying John Torode
data.meta_description: It was 14 years ago, after three and a half rounds of gruelling IVF costing £35,000, that the actress Lisa Faulkner, then just 33, was told by her IVF doctor of her unexplained infertility: “I can’t do the magic, Lisa. And for that reason, I am going to let you go.”That doctor was Mohammed Taranissi
data.text:
It was 14 years ago, after three and a half rounds of gruelling IVF costing £35,000, that the actress Lisa Faulkner, then just 33, was told by her IVF doctor of her unexplained infertility: “I can’t do the magic, Lisa. And for that reason, I am going to let you go.”

That doctor was Mohammed Taranissi, who runs the Assisted Reproduction and Gynaecology Centre just off Harley Street, known for its unusually high success rate. As she remembers, “I looked back at the past 18 months, the ectopic, the Chlomid, the fertility sticks, the highs of IVF, the madness of the drugs and the injections, and I felt lost. Emotionally drained. Physically exhausted. Completely broken. I was done.”

Faulkner describes Taranissi as “her hero”, which
